docs.text:
⚔️ Minecraft Dungeons Guides ⚔️

Your Ultimate Resource for Mastering the Dungeons

Agenciak's Guides

Comprehensive beginner-friendly guides covering melee combat, rolling mechanics, and powerful builds.

BusterCat's Guides

Expert strategies and powerful builds to maximize your efficiency and dominate the dungeons.

GrimReaper's Guides

Dark arts and mysterious strategies to conquer your enemies with devastating power.

Pancake's Guides

Creative builds and unique strategies offering fresh perspectives and innovative solutions.

Shin's Guides

Expert strategies and advanced techniques from Shin. Master the hardest content in the game.

💬 Reddit Guides

Community-curated guides from the Minecraft Dungeons subreddit. Learn from the best players.

🔗 Other Sources

Additional resources, tools, and guides from around the web. Calculators, wikis, and more!

docs.title: 🎮 Quick Start
docs.text:
New to Minecraft Dungeons? Start with Agenciak's Guides for beginner-friendly content!

Looking for creative strategies? Check out BusterCat's or Pancake's Guides for unique approaches.

Want endgame strategies? Explore Shin's Guides for expert-level tactics.

Need devastating power? GrimReaper's Guides have you covered with dark arts builds.

docs.title: 🛡️ Agenciak's Guides
docs.text: Welcome to beginner-friendly guides! Perfect for players starting their journey through Minecraft Dungeons.

Learn the fundamentals of melee combat, weapon types, and basic strategies for beginners.

💨 Rolling Mechanics Guide

Master the art of rolling and dodging to survive the toughest battles with i-frames!

Everything about enchantments in Minecraft Dungeons. Detailed breakdown of melee, armor, and ranged enchantments.

Useful terms and definitions explained in detail. Learn about DR, EHP, damage types, and more!

docs.title: 💡 What You'll Learn
docs.text:

Understanding weapon mechanics, attack patterns, and damage optimization

When to block, dodge, or run. Master defensive mechanics to survive

Recognizing and countering threats before they overwhelm you

About These Guides

All guides are written with beginners in mind. Take your time, practice the techniques, and soon you'll be ready for higher difficulties! 🎮✨

Choose a guide above to begin your journey!

docs.title: Compendium - Enchantments
docs.text: Here you will find everything about enchantments in Minecraft Dungeons

docs.title: Void Strike
docs.text:
RANK: S TYPE: DPS

Applies a damage multiplier that grows over time, this means that it's considerably better on slower weapons. The buff ranges from +25% on very fast weapons up to +175% on very slow ones.

Uses: - Every weapon faster or as fast as a tempest knife receives over +40% DPS, which outclasses every other DPS booster when it comes to all enemies. - Some builds utilize void strike along with jungle poison, due to the latter not taking it off when dealing damage, which leads to very high damage output

docs.title: Unchanting
docs.text:
RANK: S TYPE: DPS

+100% physical damage against enchanted mobs

Uses: - Very helpful in higher difficulties when enchanted mobs are very numerous and the most dangerous, a good choice for every weapon.

docs.title: Leeching
docs.text:
RANK: S TYPE: HEALING

Every mob killed with physical damage heals you for 9% of it's max health

Uses: - Builds that don't rely too much on indirect damage (which "steals" kills from leeching) can use leeching as a subside for the lifesteal aura, it's healing is better than radiance but needs kills to trigger, which can sometimes make it unreliable.

docs.title: Radiance
docs.text:
RANK: S TYPE: HEALING

Every hit has a 20% chance to trigger healing

Uses: - A healing alternative that does not need physical damage to activate, matches leeching on faster weapons.

docs.title: Guarding Strike
docs.text:
RANK: S TYPE: DEFENSE

Each physical damage kill grants 50% DR as a player status effect (which means that it doesn't diminish with other DR sources)

Uses: - Reliable non-diminishing DR source, works well as long as there is not too much indirect damage

docs.title: Weakening
docs.text:
RANK: S TYPE: DEFENSE

Hitting an enemy with physical damageinflicts a status effect reducing their damage by 40% (which translates to 40% player DR against affected mobs), diminishes with the gong of weakening (since they're both mob debuffs)

Uses: - All weapons with good AoE benefit from weakening, as long as they don't oneshot most of the enemies (like rolling build anchors)

docs.title: Glossary
docs.text: Here you will find useful terms and definitions explained in detail

docs.title: DEFENSE
docs.text:
Damage Reduction (DR) - the percentage value by which received damage is reduced (you can find specific DR values in the compendium) - formula: DR=1-1/EHP - example: 100 damage taken with 20% DR turns into 80 damage

Damage Negation (DN) - the chance of fully negating received damage - example: 100 damage taken with 30% DN gives a 30% chance of the damage "missing"

mob debuff DR - status effect inflicted on a mob that reduces it's DPS, calculated in DR and does not diminish with DR sources different than other mob debuffs

Effective Health Points (EHP) - modifier used to convert health increase into DR or vice versa - formula: EHP=1x2(DR/1-DR) - example: 50% DR is 2x EHP, which means that twice as much damage has to be taken for the health loss to be proportional

docs.title: DAMAGE
docs.text:
Physical damage - damage dealt by melee or ranged weapon hits, influenced by enchants like unchanting, critical hit or committed

Flat physical damage modifier - buffs that apply a physical damage multiplier to the base damage without interacting with each other, which means that they're first added together and then the damage is multiplied by the total - examples: reckless, overcharge, shadow form, all built-in armor damage buffs

Indirect damage - non-physical damage that does not activate enchants like guarding strike or leeching on kill, some of them get buffed by elemental focuses (poison, lightning, fire, soul) - examples: shockwave, exploding, all elemental damage

Full damage multipliers (mob debuffs) - status effects inflicted on mobs that cause them to receive greater damage - examples: gong of weakening, void strike

docs.title: MISCELLANEOUS
docs.text:
3-6 +25 trial - refers to tier III daily trial with 6 collected banner modifiers (3 threat and 3 mystery, obtained from raid captains found in some missions) on the difficulty apocalypse +25 (the max base difficulty), the hardest possible (un-modded) difficulty

META - Most Effective Tactic Available, is a very controversial term, due to just how many different build types there are. It's impossible to effectively compare a rolling build with a melee build - this causes common misuse, but the most common interpretation is that something is META if it can beat a 3-6 +25 trial

docs.title: Melee weapon
docs.text: Best weapon options for melee-focused builds, there is a lot of strong weapons but these are the most commonly used, i also added some good enchant combos

docs.title: Double Axe,  Whirlwind
docs.text:
Solid DPS paired with big area, often called the best melee weapon

+ + + (Only with lifesteal)

+ + +

docs.title: Starless Night
docs.text:
5th highest DPS in the game, big area and has Shared Pain built in

+ + + (Only with lifesteal)

+ + +

docs.title: Obsidian Claymore
docs.text:
3rd highest DPS in the game paired with big area make this weapon really strong

+ + + (Only with lifesteal)

+ + +

docs.title: Master's Katana
docs.text:
6th highest DPS in the game, solid attack area, can run Pain cycle really well because of it's combo lenght

+ / + + (Only with lifesteal)

+ / + +

docs.title: Bone Cudgel,  Boneclub
docs.text:
7th highest DPS, big attack area

+ + + (Only with lifesteal)

+ + +

docs.title: Nameless Blade
docs.text:
10th highest DPS, built in helps this weapon a lot

+ + + (Only with lifesteal)

+ + +

+ + + (Only with lifesteal)

docs.title: Growing Staff
docs.text:
11th highest DPS, Committed is built in, can use Gravity (it's attack area isn't that big, so it requires something to boost it), but also works without it

+ + + (Only with lifesteal)

+ + +

+ + +

+ + + (Only with lifesteal)

docs.title: Bee Stinger,  Rapier,  Freezing Foil
docs.text:
Very fast hits, long reach, small area (requires Gravity), because of common Thundering use it gets buffed by Lightning focus a lot

+ + +

+ + +

+ + + (Only with lifesteal)

docs.title: Fighter's Bindings
docs.text:
Very fast with a short combo and small area, because of common Thundering use it gets buffed by Lightning focus a lot (This weapon has over 20 "good!!!" combinations, i'm not gonna list them all, the subjectively best ones are the following)

+ + +

+ + + ( Ambush gives you a +60% DPS buff to enemies stunned by Stunning, making them a very effective combo for fast weapons)

+ + + (Only with lifesteal)

+ + +

docs.title: Armor
docs.text: Best armor options for melee-focused builds

docs.title: Wither Armor
docs.text:
• Lifesteal aura (heals you for 6% of your weapon's direct damage (so enchants like Shockwave, Swirling or Thundering don't fuel it, if you're using lifesteal armor, these are the enchants you want to avoid, also it's an aura, meaning that your allies also benefit from it)
  • +35% Damage reduction

docs.title: Spider Armor
docs.text:
• Lifesteal aura
  • +25% faster attack speed

docs.title: Renegade Armor
docs.text:
• +20% weapon damage boost aura
  • +25% faster attack speed
  • +35% damage reduction

Enchantments

Cooldown - mandatory, allows for infinite deathcap mushroom and iron hide amulet at high power levels

Potion barrier - very good, gives you 90% DR for 9 seconds every time your health potion is used, very strong when paired with Refreshment

Deflecting - very good, has a 45% to block 100% damage from incoming projectiles and deflect them to their source

Chilling - very good, slows enemies (Triggers every 2 seconds)

Snowball - very good, stuns one enemy for 1 second every second (it can save you in close meetings with creepers)

Death barter - good, allows you to respawn with 100% health, the downside of it is that discards everything you earned during the mission, it's not the best possible option for builds focusing on not dying at all (melee/tank builds)

Cowardice - good, if you have full HP, you deal 40% more damage, melee builds take a lot of damage but with solid healing it's a good DPS booster

Surprise gift - only in specific builds, you have 50% chance to create a random consumable item, but that also could be used by itself, but combined with Refreshment it can be really helpful, often used alongside Potion Barrier in health potion spam builds

Reckless - only in specific builds, you have 40% less HP, but deal 90% more damage, it should be used only in builds with a lot of damage reduction

docs.title: Ranged Weapons
docs.text: Your ranged weapon doesn't really matter in melee builds, you could preferably use a one-shot bow (elite power bow with enchants like + + ) to easily clear out stronger enemies or an imploding crossbow with Refreshment to utilise potion enchants like barrier more effectively

docs.title: What is a "rolling build"?
docs.text:
The core of it being rolling build is Burstbowstring paired with Cooldown shot and a Light feather, how does it work? Burstbowstring triggers every time you roll, shooting out 1 fully charged arrow per enemy (up to 3 arrows), each of them triggers Cooldownshot speeding up your artifact cooldown 1.5s per charged shot, Light feather has a 3s cooldown, which means that you get to roll constantly shooting 3 charged arrows (which shortens your cooldown by 4.5s, allowing for a second roll using the feather right after) every time you do it with the only condition being close to at least 2 enemies

Remember that you need a ton of arrows for it to work, that's why you need Looting or Infinity

docs.title: Ranged Weapon
docs.text: Best options for a rolling bow

docs.title: Winter's Touch
docs.text:
If your build uses any quiver artifacts, this is what you're looking for

  • Shoots out 3 arrows when charged (In a rolling build it means 9 arrows for every roll, because 3 arrows per 1 shot and Burstbowstring provides 3 shots)
  • Slows down hit enemies

docs.title: Pink Scoundrel
docs.text:
• ricochets after hitting an enemy
  • has a chance to "enrage" mobs (makes them attack everything instead of focusing on the player, other enemies, passive animals but still can target players)

docs.title: Bubble Burster
docs.text:
• ricochets after hitting an enemy
  • traps enemies in bubbles

docs.title: Enchantments
docs.text:
Burstbowstring - mandatory

Cooldown shot - mandatory

Infinity - if you use quivers, has a chance to not use up your arrow

Looting - if you don't use quivers,

Multishot - if you use Winter's touch, has a 40% to turn each arrow you shoot out into 5 projectiles, it's very effective on Winter's touch, because it shoots out 3 arrows (meaning each of them has a 40% chance for it activate)

Tempo theft - good, slows down enemies and speeds you up

Wild rage - good, enrages mobs

Voidstrike shot - good, applies a damage multiplier, weaker than melee Voidstrike (added)

docs.title: Melee weapon
docs.text: You can exploit the fact that you constantly roll by using weapons with "jungle poison" transfer their damage into the poison, paired with which makes the poison deal up to 600% damage you are able to oneshot most bosses easily

docs.title: Encrusted Anchor
docs.text:
Very high damage and area

+ + / + / / /

docs.title: Vine Whip
docs.text:
Long reach, high damage

+ + + / / /

docs.title: Armor
docs.text: Best armor choices for a rolling build

docs.title: Shadow Walker
docs.text:
For normal rolling

  • invulnerability while rolling
  • +35% damage reduction
  • -50% rolling cooldown

+ + / / + ( Lightning focus only with Thundering Quiver or Satchel of Elements)

docs.title: Glow Squid Armor
docs.text:
For normal rolling

  • invulnerability while rolling
  • +15% movespeed aura
  • shoots out ink, making enemies miss some hits

+ + / / + ( Lightning focus only with Thundering Quiver or Satchel of Elements)

docs.title: Splendid Robe
docs.text:
For artifact spam

  • +40% artifact cooldown
  • +30% melee damage
  • +50% artifact damage

+ + +
